page.title: 09BISHOP'S CLEEVE: Its Past
page.content: {Bishop's Cleeve}is mentioned in Domesday 1086.It was owned by the Bishop of Worcester.30 hides were cultivated by 35 people.There are two ancient buildings:{The Tythe Barn},now a Village Hall and {Cleeve Hall}built in 13th century by the Bishops of Worcester. In 1945 the houses were scattered among orchards and the population was 700. The nearest doctor was at Winchcombe and medicine was put in a biscuit box in the Hall of a village house.There are now 2 surgeries and a chemist. A Visiting cinema used to show films in the Tythe Barn,now people travel to a local town.The blacksmith's forge is now a fish and chip shop. Gilders the Butchers is the oldest surviving shop. During the war years,few people had cars,but the A435 was busy with American transport stationed nearby.
